title: 1922-A
statement: A. Tricky Templatetime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given an integer $$$n$$$ and three strings $$$a, b, c$$$, each consisting of $$$n$$$ lowercase Latin letters.Let a template be a string $$$t$$$ consisting of $$$n$$$ lowercase and/or uppercase Latin letters. The string $$$s$$$ matches the template $$$t$$$ if the following conditions hold for all $$$i$$$ from $$$1$$$ to $$$n$$$:if the $$$i$$$-th letter of the template islowercase, then $$$s_i$$$ must bethe sameas $$$t_i$$$;if the $$$i$$$-th letter of the template isuppercase, then $$$s_i$$$ must bedifferentfrom thelowercase versionof $$$t_i$$$. For example, if there is a letter 'A' in the template, you cannot use the letter 'a' in the corresponding position of the string.Accordingly, the string doesn't match the template if the condition doesn't hold for at least one $$$i$$$.Determine whether there exists a template $$$t$$$ such that the strings $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$ match it, while the string $$$c$$$ does not.InputThe first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 1000$$$) — the number of test cases.The first line of each test case contains an integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 20$$$) — the length of the given strings.The next three lines contain the strings $$$a, b$$$ and $$$c$$$. Each string consists of exactly $$$n$$$ lowercase Latin letters.OutputFor each testcase, print "YES" if there exists a template $$$t$$$ such that the strings $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$ match it, while the string $$$c$$$ does not. Otherwise, print "NO".ExampleInput41abc2aabbaa10mathforcesluckforcesadhoccoder3accabdabcOutputYES NO YES NONoteIn the first test case, you can use the template "C". The first letter of strings $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$ differ from 'c', so they match the template. The first letter of string $$$c$$$ equals 'c', so it doesn't match.In the third test case, you can use the template "CODEforces".

processed.result:
You are given three strings,  $a$, $b$, and $c$, each of length $n$.  

Determine if there exists a string $t$ of length $n$ (which can contain both lowercase and uppercase letters) such that:

* String $a$ matches $t$ 
* String $b$ matches $t$
* String $c$ does not match $t$

A string matches a template $t$ if:

* If a letter in $t$ is lowercase, the corresponding letter in the string must be the same.
* If a letter in $t$ is uppercase, the corresponding letter in the string must be different from the lowercase version of that letter.

For each test case, output "YES" if such a template $t$ exists, otherwise output "NO".
Given three strings of the same length, determine if there is a pattern where two of the strings match the pattern but the third string does not.
